paper.title: Support Vector Machines through Financial Time Series Forecasting
paper.abstract: Support vector machines (SVMs) are promising methods for the prediction of the financial time-series because they use a risk function, consisting of an empirical error and a regularized term, which is derived from the structural risk minimization principle. This study applies SVM for predicting the stock price index. In addition, this study examines the feasibility of the applying SVM in financial forecasting by comparing it with the back-propagation neural networks and case based reasoning. The experimental results show that SVM provides a promising alternative to the stock market prediction.

domain_result.justification: 该论文主要研究支持向量机在金融时间序列预测中的应用，特别是股票价格指数的预测。虽然涉及金融市场，但并未明确指出其应用于衍生品定价、金融风险管理或投资组合管理等特定领域。
